answers.answer: Well if meat is making you sick be sure to eat other sources of protein like beans. I got some poweraid and flavored water to keep hydrated. I also add lemons to my water there's a lot you can do! Good luck hope I helped!
Why can't you eat any meat? Eat lots of beans and peanut butter for protein.

I had the same problem. I'm 38+6 and still have it. Apparently it's normal for some women. Our senses are stronger and it could be our bodies telling us that those food choices are not good for us. The few times I have eaten meat it had to be almost burnt for me to even consider eating it. I have a total aversion to pork. Chkn can only be fried and I still probably won't eat it, and beef always is well done. It's very frustrating. I mostly just eat side items.Make sure you're taking your pre natals, load up on veggies when you can and eat nuts and beans at least to get protein etc.As far as water, maybe adding a few slices of fresh fruit will favor it enough for you to drink it better.
I'm a vegetarian and my son was born 8lb 10oz and I'm 5`1 and had gestational diabetes. Eat eggs, beans, and vegetables.
I'm having the same issue... Find alternatives. Sourdough bread has decent amount of protein in it for example.
I'm having the same issue... Find alternatives. Sourdough bread has decent amount of protein in it for example.
I couldn't eat meat for awhile... I would go to panera bread and have soup pasta and grilled cheese

I don't like meat right now or should I say baby does not like meat. I eat pasta without meat and I like cheese pan pizza and those are normally things I would rather not eat without meat. It is crazy what happens to your body while pregnant.

question: 14 weeks and 4 days can't eat any meat & have a problem drinking plain water. I want my bby to be healthy.
title: help
